description: Californian allspice (Calycanthus occidentalis) is an amazing plant species that can add beauty to backyard landscapes with its glossy, deep green leaves and marbled bark. Its flower blooms during the spring and summer months, with an incredibly fragrant aroma that mimics a combination of clove, cinnamon, and nutmeg. This shrub thrives in moist, well-drained soil and can reach up to 6-12 feet in height and width. Californian Allspice is also highly adaptable to various climates and provides both year-round beauty and wildlife support as a nectar source. It's an incredibly resilient plant that will add a delightful touch to any garden.
